title: American_Top_40_1984_December_15th
description:
"We're counting down the hottest hits in the nation on American Top 40. I'm Casey Kasem, and the countdown continues."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

There is a band that claims to be named after a color of paint.

Two listeners want to know, "Who is the youngest singer to ever hit the top 40?" His song made number 6 in 1955.

This countdown marks the sixth time in chart history that siblings have appeared with separate solo hits. Casey gives details about the other five times.

Casey explains how Lionel Richie got conned into writing a song that spent nine weeks at number one.

Casey also plays a portion of a song recorded by the youngest group to ever hit the top 40. Their average age was 12 years and 10 months.

LW#1: Out Of Touch - Daryl Hall & John Oates
